11.text: No. SEBI/LAD-NRO/GN/2018/39. - In exercise of the powers conferred by section 30 read with sub-section (1) of section 11 and section 28A of the Securities and Exchange Board of India Act, 1992 (15 of 1992), section 23JB of the Securities Contracts (Regulations) Act, 1956 and section 19-IB of the Depositories Act, 1996, the Board hereby makes the following regulations, namely,-
nounChunks: section 11 and section 28A of the Securities and Exchange Board of India Act, 1992
the powers conferred by section 30 read with sub-section (1) of section 11 and section 28A of the Securities and Exchange Board of India Act, 1992
section 30 read with sub-section (1) of section 11 and section 28A of the Securities and Exchange Board of India Act, 1992

coref: SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE BOARD OF INDIA
the Securities and Exchange Board of India Act
the Securities and Exchange Board of India Act

15.text: 1. (1) These regulations may be called the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Appointment of Administrator and Procedure for Refunding to the Investors) Regulations, 2018.
ents: Securities and Exchange Board of India
coref: the Securities and Exchange Board of India
the Securities and Exchange Board of India

16.text: (2) They shall come into force on the date of their notification in the Official Gazette.

18.text: 2.(1) In these regulations, unless the context otherwise requires,-

19.text: a)“Act” means the Securities and Exchange Board of India Act, 1992 [15 of 1992];

28.text: g)"defaulter" for the purposes of these regulations, means a person who has failed to comply with an order of the Board to refund monies to the investors or an order of the Board for disgorgement within the specified time period and who is mentioned as a defaulter in the certificate;

41.text: 3. (1) These regulations shall be applicable for all or any of the following:

42.text: a.appointment of Administrator pursuant to failure to comply with disgorgement or refund orders passed by the Board;
nounChunks: disgorgement or refund orders passed by the Board
failure to comply with disgorgement or refund orders passed by the Board

43.text: b.sale of properties attached by the Recovery Officer of the Board under the Act;
nounChunks: properties attached by the Recovery Officer of the Board under the Act
the Recovery Officer of the Board
cleanedUpEnts: the Recovery Officer of the Board

44.text: c.collection of claim documents and verification of claims of investors for the purpose of effecting refunds;
nounChunks: claim documents and verification of claims of investors for the purpose of effecting refunds
c.collection of claim documents and verification of claims of investors for the purpose of effecting refunds;

45.text: d.refund of monies to the investors pursuant to disgorgement or refund orders passed by the Board;
nounChunks: disgorgement or refund orders passed by the Board

46.text: e.recovery of disgorgement amounts directed by the Board;
nounChunks: disgorgement amounts directed by the Board
cleanedUpEnts: disgorgement amounts directed by the Board

47.text: f.any act incidental or connected thereto.

48.text: (2)Unless otherwise specifically ordered, these regulations shall not be applicable to cases where the Securities Appellate Tribunal or a Court has appointed an administrator or any other person for the purposes of recovery and/or repayment to investors.
nounChunks: cases where the Securities Appellate Tribunal or a Court has appointed an administrator or any other person for the purposes of recovery
the Securities Appellate Tribunal or a Court
an administrator or any other person for the purposes of recovery

50.text: (3)The provisions of these regulations shall apply mutatis mutandis in respect of the proceedings under the Securities Contracts (Regulation) Act, 1956 or the Depositories Act, 1996.
nounChunks: the proceedings under the Securities Contracts (Regulation) Act, 1956 or the Depositories Act, 1996
the Securities Contracts (Regulation) Act, 1956 or the Depositories Act, 1996
respect of the proceedings under the Securities Contracts (Regulation) Act, 1956 or the Depositories Act, 1996

54.text: 4.For the purposes of these regulations, the Board shall, after attachment of the properties of the defaulter by the Recovery Officer, appoint an Administrator in the manner specified.
nounChunks: the properties of the defaulter by the Recovery Officer
attachment of the properties of the defaulter by the Recovery Officer

55.text: Eligibility norms for appointment as an Administrator.

56.text: 5.(1) The Administrator shall be a person registered with the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Board of India as an Insolvency Resolution Professional and empanelled by the Board from time to time.
nounChunks: the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Board of India
a person registered with the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Board of India as an Insolvency Resolution Professional
coref: the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Board of India
the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Board of India
the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Board of India

57.text: (2) No person shall be appointed as an Administrator where such an appointment may be objected to on the grounds that give rise to justifiable doubts as to the independence or impartiality of such a person:
nounChunks: the independence or impartiality of such a person
an Administrator where such an appointment may be objected to on the grounds that give rise to justifiable doubts as to the independence or impartiality of such a person
the grounds that give rise to justifiable doubts as to the independence or impartiality of such a person

58.text: Provided that any question involving issues of conflict of interest in the appointment of an Administrator shall be decided by the Recovery Officer.
nounChunks: any question involving issues of conflict of interest in the appointment of an Administrator
conflict of interest in the appointment of an Administrator
issues of conflict of interest in the appointment of an Administrator

59.text: (3) The Administrator shall provide an undertaking to the Board of absence of any conflict of interest with the defaulter, its directors, promoters, key managerial personnel and its group entities.
nounChunks: promoters, key managerial personnel and its group entities
any conflict of interest with the defaulter, its directors, promoters, key managerial personnel and its group entities
the defaulter, its directors, promoters, key managerial personnel and its group entities
its directors, promoters, key managerial personnel and its group entities
the Board of absence of any conflict of interest with the defaulter, its directors, promoters, key managerial personnel and its group entities
key managerial personnel and its group entities
coref: the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Board of India

60.text: (4) The Administrator shall also forthwith disclose to the Board any conflict of interest which may come to his knowledge during his tenure:
nounChunks: any conflict of interest which may come to his knowledge during his tenure
coref: the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Board of India
the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Board of India

61.text: (5) For the purposes of these regulations, the Administrator shall be deemed to be a public servant within the meaning of section 21 of the Indian Penal Code (45 of 1860) and sections 22 and 23 of the Act shall accordingly apply to him.
nounChunks: the meaning of section 21 of the Indian Penal Code (45 of 1860)
section 21 of the Indian Penal Code (45 of 1860)

63.text: 6.The terms and conditions of appointment including remuneration shall be specified by the Board, on a case to case basis, after taking into consideration the quantum of work, the number of investors and the quantum of money involved.
nounChunks: the number of investors and the quantum of money
a case to case basis, after taking into consideration the quantum of work, the number of investors and the quantum of money involved
6.The terms and conditions of appointment including remuneration
coref: the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Board of India

65.text: Part II - Functions of the Administrator
nounChunks: Part II - Functions of the Administrator

66.text: 7.(1) An Administrator shall perform the following functions –

67.text: (a)As may be directed by the Recovery Officer, obtain from the defaulter or any other person, any information or document including documents relating to ownership and possession of properties, details of amount raised from investors, claims of investors, amount claimed to have been refunded to investors;
nounChunks: the defaulter or any other person, any information or document including documents relating to ownership and possession of properties
documents relating to ownership and possession of properties
details of amount raised from investors, claims of investors
any information or document including documents relating to ownership and possession of properties

68.text: (b)Make a record of the properties that have been attached by the Recovery Officer including the additional properties that have been entrusted by the Recovery Officer from time to time and those properties which are not part of the attachment order;
nounChunks: those properties which are not part of the attachment order
the additional properties that have been entrusted by the Recovery Officer from time to time and those properties which are not part of the attachment order

the properties that have been attached by the Recovery Officer including the additional properties that have been entrusted by the Recovery Officer from time to time and those properties which are not part of the attachment order

(b)Make a record of the properties that have been attached by the Recovery Officer including the additional properties that have been entrusted by the Recovery Officer from time to time and those properties which are not part of the attachment order;

69.text: (c)Make a record of the bank accounts and dematerialised accounts of the defaulter and value of the monies and securities held thereunder;
nounChunks: the defaulter and value of the monies and securities
a record of the bank accounts
accounts of the defaulter and value of the monies and securities

70.text: (d)Arrange for a proclamation for the sale of the property and arrange affixation of the copy of such proclamation in accordance with the provisions of the Act;
nounChunks: accordance with the provisions of the Act
such proclamation in accordance with the provisions of the Act
affixation of the copy of such proclamation in accordance with the provisions of the Act
the copy of such proclamation in accordance with the provisions of the Act
a proclamation for the sale of the property
arrange affixation of the copy of such proclamation in accordance with the provisions of the Act

71.text: (e)Open an interest bearing bank account, under the control of the Recovery Officer, with a scheduled public sector bank for depositing the proceeds of the money recovered from the sale of the assets and for making repayment to the investors;
nounChunks: a scheduled public sector bank for depositing the proceeds of the money recovered from the sale of the assets and for making repayment to the investors
the proceeds of the money recovered from the sale of the assets and for making repayment to the investors
the money recovered from the sale of the assets and for making repayment to the investors
the control of the Recovery Officer

72.text: (f)Sell the attached properties in accordance with these regulations or as may be directed by the Recovery Officer;
nounChunks: the attached properties in accordance with these regulations
(f)Sell the attached properties in accordance with these regulations or as may be directed by the Recovery Officer;

73.text: (g)Call for claims, in the manner specified in these regulations or as may be directed by the Recovery Officer, for the purposes of repayment to investors, pursuant to an order of the Board for refunds;
nounChunks: an order of the Board for refunds
the purposes of repayment to investors

74.text: (h)Verify the claims of investors and also that of the defaulter in respect of repayment of monies, either partly paid or wholly paid, claimed to have been made to investors on the basis of documentary evidence:
nounChunks: the claims of investors and also that of the defaulter in respect of repayment of monies
the defaulter in respect of repayment of monies

75.text: Explanation – Verification may involve forensic auditing.

76.text: (i)Carry out any other necessary incidental and supplementary act, with the prior approval of the Recovery Officer that may be required for the purpose of carrying out its obligations under these regulations.
nounChunks: the prior approval of the Recovery Officer that may be required for the purpose of carrying out its obligations under these regulations
any other necessary incidental and supplementary act
the purpose of carrying out its obligations under these regulations

77.text: (2)While discharging the functions under these regulations, the Administrator -

78.text: (a)may engage the services of a peer reviewed chartered accountant for verifying the claims of investors on the basis of documentary evidence and for submission of a certified report to the Administrator;

82.text: Officer, for managing the entire repayment process.

83.text: Provided that the fees paid for such services shall be fixed by the Administrator taking into account the relevant factors including –

89.text: Provided further that the intermediary or such other person engaged by the Administrator, shall not have any conflict of interest which would impede their independence or impartiality.

90.text: (3)The Administrator shall submit a monthly report or a report as and when called for by the Recovery Officer on the progress of work entrusted including the monies realised pursuant to the sale of the properties and the repayments made to the investors.
nounChunks: the progress of work entrusted including the monies

92.text: 8.(1) The Administrator shall undertake the process of sale of properties after conducting an independent valuation of such properties by a registered valuer.
nounChunks: the process of sale of properties
an independent valuation of such properties by a registered valuer

93.text: (2) After considering the valuation report, the Recovery Officer may decide on the reserve price below which the property may not be sold.
nounChunks: the reserve price below which the property may not be sold

94.text: (3) The Administrator may undertake the sale of properties through e-auction process and for this purpose engage an e-auction agency and shall in consultation with the Recovery Officer repeat the auction process till the time such properties are disposed off.
nounChunks: the time such properties are disposed off

95.text: (4)The process of disposing off the properties shall be under the supervision of the Recovery Officer.
nounChunks: 4)The process of disposing off the properties
the supervision of the Recovery Officer

97.text: (5)On completion of the sale and receipt of the sale consideration, the Recovery Officer shall issue an order confirming such sale in accordance with the Act.
nounChunks: the sale and receipt of the sale consideration
such sale in accordance with the Act
an order confirming such sale in accordance with the Act

98.text: (6)The amount realized in respect of sale of properties of the defaulter shall be deposited in a separate bank account with a scheduled public sector bank in terms of clause (e) of regulation 7 and such account shall be under the control of the Recovery Officer.
nounChunks: respect of sale of properties of the defaulter
sale of properties of the defaulter
a separate bank account with a scheduled public sector bank
the control of the Recovery Officer

101.text: 9.(1) For the purposes of inviting claims from the investors, the Administrator shall -
nounChunks: the purposes of inviting claims from the investors

102.text: (a) issue advertisements in an English and a Hindi newspaper having nationwide circulation and if so directed by the Recovery Officer, issue such advertisement in vernacular newspaper(s) having circulation in the area(s) where the investors are concentrated;
nounChunks: an English and a Hindi newspaper

(a) issue advertisements in an English and a Hindi newspaper having nationwide circulation and if so directed by the Recovery Officer, issue such advertisement in vernacular newspaper(s) having circulation in the area(s) where the investors are concentrated;

103.text: (b) direct the defaulter to issue advertisement in its website, if available.

104.text: (2) The advertisement referred to sub-regulation (1) may also be hosted on the website of the Board.

105.text: (3) The advertisements referred to in sub-regulation (1) shall contain instructions on the manner of making claims by investors and the documents and information that are to be submitted for verifying and processing their claim applications.
nounChunks: verifying and processing their claim applications
the manner of making claims by investors and the documents and information that are to be submitted for verifying and processing their claim applications

106.text: (4) The invitation of claims from the investors shall be through electronic mode or be received in the office of the Administrator;
nounChunks: The invitation of claims from the investors

107.text: Provided that the investors’ claims received, if any, by the Board and forwarded to the Administrator shall also be included in the relevant records maintained by the Administrator.
nounChunks: the relevant records maintained by the Administrator

108.text: (5)The Administrator or the chartered accountant engaged by the Administrator, shall consider the total eligible claims as against the monies available for distribution to investors in order to determine whether the whole amount or a proportionate amount may be repaid to the investors as may be directed by the Recovery Officer.
nounChunks: order to determine whether the whole amount or a proportionate amount may be repaid to the investors as may be directed by the Recovery Officer
the whole amount or a proportionate amount
the monies available for distribution to investors

109.text: (6)Upon ascertaining the eligibility, the Administrator in consultation with the Recovery Officer, shall repay the money to the eligible investors only through pay orders, demand drafts and electronic transfer through NEFT or RTGS.
nounChunks: pay orders, demand drafts and electronic transfer through NEFT or RTGS
demand drafts and electronic transfer through NEFT or RTGS
the Administrator in consultation with the Recovery Officer

110.text: (7)The refund process shall be kept open for an appropriate period as may be decided in consultation with the Recovery Officer.

112.text: (8)The monies remaining in the interest bearing escrow bank account after satisfying all the permissible claims of investors and other charges, shall be retained therein for a period of three years in order to meet the claims that may be received from any unpaid investor.
nounChunks: 8)The monies remaining in the interest bearing escrow bank account after satisfying all the permissible claims of investors and other charges
order to meet the claims that may be received from any unpaid investor

all the permissible claims of investors and other charges
the interest bearing escrow bank account

113.text: (9)Upon completion of the period specified under sub-regulation (8), the unpaid monies due to investors, if any, shall be transferred to the Investor Protection and Education Fund of the Board.
nounChunks: the Investor Protection and Education Fund of the Board
the Investor Protection and Education Fund
9)Upon completion of the period specified under sub-regulation (8), the unpaid monies due to investors
the unpaid monies due to investors
cleanedUpEnts: the Investor Protection and Education Fund
the Investor Protection and Education Fund of the Board

114.text: (10)In case any claim is received from an unpaid investor after the refund process has been closed, the same may be made from the Investor Protection and Education Fund after necessary verification by the Administrator in consultation with the Recovery Officer:

137.text: Part VI - General obligations and responsibilities
nounChunks: Part VI - General obligations and responsibilities

140.text: a)shall maintain high standards of integrity, promptitude and fairness in the conduct of all his business.
nounChunks: high standards of integrity, promptitude and fairness in the conduct of all his business
the conduct of all his business

141.text: b)shall act with due skill, care and diligence in the conduct of all his business.
nounChunks: due skill, care and diligence in the conduct of all his business
b)shall act with due skill, care and diligence in the conduct of all his business.
the conduct of all his business

142.text: c)shall not misrepresent any facts or situations and shall refrain from being involved in any action that would bring disrepute to the profession.
nounChunks: any action that would bring disrepute to the profession

143.text: d)shall act with objectivity during the course of his professional dealings by ensuring that all decisions are made without any bias, conflict of interest, coercion, or undue influence of any party, whether directly or indirectly connected to sale of properties, verification of claims and refund of monies.
nounChunks: interest, coercion, or undue influence of any party
coercion, or undue influence of any party
any bias, conflict of interest, coercion, or undue influence of any party,
conflict of interest, coercion, or undue influence of any party,
the course of his professional dealings

144.text: e)shall not acquire, directly or indirectly, any of the assets of the defaulter.

145.text: f)shall maintain complete independence in all professional relationships and conduct the verification and refund process, as the case may be, independent of external influences.
nounChunks: complete independence in all professional relationships

146.text: g)shall not conceal any material information or knowingly make a misleading statement to the Recovery Officer or the Board.
nounChunks: a misleading statement to the Recovery Officer or the Board
the Recovery Officer or the Board
coref: the Recovery Officer or the Board
the Recovery Officer or the Board

147.text: h)shall not act with mala fide or be negligent while performing the functions and duties under the regulations.

148.text: i)shall provide all information and records as may be required by the Recovery Officer within the time specified by him.

149.text: j)shall ensure that confidentiality of the information relating to the sale of properties, verification and refund process, is maintained at all times: Provided that the Administrator may disclose any information after obtaining written authorization of the Recovery Officer or the Board.

the Recovery Officer or the Board
